A new era of scientific exploration and discovery, as scientists would be able to study the effects of aging on the human body and potentially find ways to it.
A shift in societal values and beliefs, as people would have to reconsider what it means to be alive and how to live their lives.
A rise in population growth, as people would no longer fear death and would be more likely to have children.
A change in the job market, as many jobs that are currently considered high-risk or require physical labor would become obsolete.
A potential for ethical dilemmas, as immortality could lead to overpopulation and strain on resources, and could also raise questions about the value of human life.
